snippet: Raj Rajaratnam, who is serving 11 years in prison for insider trading, and the Galleon Group have been sued by his younger brother for $13.5 million.
abstract: Galleon Group and founder Raj Rajaratnam, who is serving time in prison for insider trading at his hedge fund, are being sued by his brother Rengan for $13.5 million; Rengan contends he is owed commissions and legal costs.
lead_paragraph: Raj Rajaratnam, who is serving 11 years in prison for insider trading, and the Galleon Group have been sued by his younger brother for $13.5 million.

headline.main: Founder of Galleon Group Is Sued by Younger Brother
headline.print_headline: Founder of Galleon Group Is Sued by Younger Brother
